dmca.title: [ThePlanetAbuse-C2721656M] Re: [Abuse #LVI-385260]: Site causing high load.

MIME element (text/plain)
Hello David, 
 
A few of my clients just alarmed me about a web site that is illegally
distrubiting some of my information products.  
 
They are selling my info products with "resale rights" and telling other
people the can sell them too. This is going to start a chainball effect
that is going to get very ugly. I never gave anyone permission to sell
my products in this manner. The website I'm talking about is hosted on
hostgator.com servers and is located at: 
 
http://www.private-label-rights-software-and-ebooks.com 
 
There's a hot thread about this issue going on in the most popular
Internet Marketing forum right now. You can read about it at: 
 
http://www.warriorforum.com/forum/topic.asp?TOPIC_ID=130118&whichpage=1 
 
Please do something about this right away. The titles of the ebooks that
belong to me are: 
 
 - AdSense Revenue Exposed
 - Ghostwriters From The Inside Out
 - Offline Marketing Strategies For Online Businesses
 - Bloggers Guide To Profits
 - Mining Gold From Ebay
 - Offline Marketing Strategies For Online Businesses
 - PC Safety 101
 - Podcasting Made Easy
 - The Newbie's Guide To Making Software
 - Starting a Paid Membership Website 
 
I look forward to hearing back from you. 
 
Thank you, 
 
Michael Rasmussen 
 
 
 
 
Quoting Hostgator Abuse <abuse@hostgator.com>: 
 
> Hello,
> I didn't disable /home/mpras/public_html/horses-edu/links/admin 
> someone else must have because of the resource usage.  You could move 
> to a SemiDedicated server, but honestly there shouldn't be any reason 
> why your script is using this many resources.  We have many other 
> clients on the server who run 5 or more MySQL databases without any 
> issues.  The reaons why this is happening is due to the inefficiency
of the script.  This is what I usually recommend....
>  
> If you want to have a very efficient script, hire a developer to 
> custom write one for you, so it does what you want and isn't as bulky,

> which will save you money in the future.  The other option is to use a

> SemiDedicated server, but the more sites you host on it the more 
> loaded the server will be.  It is honestly up to you.  We have many 
> large sites that we host, that use almost no resources at all.
>  
> Thank you. 
>  
> If there is anything else we can assist you with please do not 
> hesitate to ask.
>  
> Regards, 
>         David Collins 
>         HostGator Technical Support
>  
> =-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-
> Visit Our Knowledgebase & Ticket System!

Michael Rasmussen
